reviews.text: My dear friend and I go away for lots of girls only weekends. I chose this hotel on the recommendation of another friend who comes here with her good friend. It is the perfect hotel for this type of getaway. We didn't use the spa on this visit but we will be back and will next time. We visited the Elms and planned our time so that we could be back to the hotel to check in and have afternoon tea. Check in was so easy though we did have a very long walk to our room, down three long corridors.
reviews.title: Lovely Girls Getaway Weekend

reviews.text: The room was lovely, beautiful bedding, loads of pillows, a desk, Keurig and a small but functional bathroom. The WiFi was free and fast and there was never a problem accessing it.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the afternoon tea so much that we had dinner at the hotel as well. The food and service was perfect. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and smiled and asked us how we were enjoying our stay.
reviews.title: Stayed a few times, can't wait to go back

reviews.text: We had an issue with the soundproof, there was a lot of running and jumping above us. When I called the front desk and asked if we could possibly be moved, we were. Thank you Eric for all the help you provided. When I had trouble with the heat in the new room, he helped me get it right.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel & Staff!
Another fine stay at the Viking.
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is convenient, the staff is top notch and the food is very good. Do I love everything, well no. I think offering 1 complimentary bottle of water in the room would be nice, $5 Fuji is just too expensive and there is not a store in the hotel that sells water. I also will bring some of my own coffee K-cups next time because I just won't pay $2 a cup beyond the two regular and 2 decaf that are provided free.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed over New Years weekend in an "Estate Guestroom" in the "older" part of the hotel. The room was obviously recently refurbished and in immaculate condition. I was disappointed to find a queen bed instead of a king, but checking back I see that the website said "king or queen". The room was not large, but had a reasonable amount of space and was nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable with high end linens and plenty of pillows and comforters.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel. Excellent service. Couple of issues...

reviews.text: Service from everyone - valets, front desk, waitstaff in the restaurant, maintenanc was cheerful and efficient - as good as it gets anywhere.
reviews.title: Christmas at the Viking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The issues - the first night our heat didn't work - fan blew but cold air came out. Called maintenance in the morning and a man came immediately and fixed it (perhaps this isn't an issue at all).
reviews.title: Despite a flu bug, Viking hotel saved the day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the first and third mornings of our stay we awoke to an unpleasant cooking smell in the room. As we were on the fourth floor (room 401) it's hard to say where it came from - since it didn't happen on day 2 we assumed it had to do with the misbehaving heating system - have no explanation for why it returned on day 3. We did not notify the hotel of this, but I know they read these reviews.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay in a luxurious hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most vexing problem was the toilet. For reasons I can't fathom, it was placed within 3 or 4 inches of the wall right next to the bathroom door. Worse, the toilet paper hanger was on that same wall so that one had to be a contortionist to reach it while sitting - particularly if one is large and not especially limber. It was so unpleasant to use that I took to answering natures call at a very nice public men's room located on the meeting room level.
reviews.title: conveniently located, quaint

reviews.text: Another business trip to Newport RI and yet another, no surprise welcome at the Viking. My preferred place to stay while in this lovely part of the State. Room quality and service is second to none. Prices more than acceptable. If you travel alone or with the love of your life, highly recommend it. Ask for a suite upgrade if available in the "old part" of the property. Charming. Period.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Viking.

reviews.text: We love Hotel Viking! From the staff, to the wonderful restaurant, pool, spa - all top notch and worth the trip! Great location - you can walk to town or drive to one of the beaches in minutes. Shopping, lots of restaurant choices, or everything you could need right at the hotel! Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Great location, staff, amenities!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tracey C.
reviews.title: A great stay at a historic hotel

reviews.text: A great stay at a historic hotel
reviews.title: Best of Newport ... But, that's not saying much!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Viking for a little weekend getaway after the Thanksgiving holiday. The Hotel Viking was a pleasant offseason surprise.
reviews.title: Great hotel with a great location

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in December 2012. I read the reviews others have posted online as well and concur with some of the points that they made. First when we arrived at the hotel, the valet parking is $15. I don't think that is too bad considering it is Newport. Check in was fairly easy. The staff seemed friendly but when I inquired about an upgrade for our room, we were told it was an extra $50-$100 a night ( I thought it was less online but perhaps I was mistaken.) The room itself was very small. Honestly, one of the smallest hotel rooms I have been in. The bathroom had what I would define as the smallest sink I have ever seen. It wouldn't have been a problem but there were no shelves or anything to put your toothbrush or toiletries on. I literally had to open the shower door to allow myself enough arm room to blow dry my hair. The room was nicely appointed however and did appear clean. The other complaint that I had, as another writer had commented, is the blind situation. The room gets very bright early in the morning due to the blinds. This could be easily resolved by hanging curtains that cover the spaces in the windows where the sun light comes through so I was surprised that was a issue. The noise level was also a consideration. The room next to us had someone come back late at night and we could hear them like they were in the room next to us. Luckily they went to bed pretty soon thereafter but if they had been up all night that could have been an issue.
reviews.title: Hotel Viking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did go to the pool, which was very nice. Good water temperature and it was clean. I also liked the pool furniture that was in the area. The fitness center was nice, and all the equipment was clean and functional so that was great! The one thing that I will say stands out about this hotel was the staff. You can have a great hotel and horrible staff, or you can have an average hotel and great staff ( which I felt was the case here ). The valet service was great, and at breakfast, I went to get my daughter a bagel and the man saw her and said, "oh, its fine, just help yourself to one, no charge." The hotel is also decorated for Christmas so they have the Christmas trees up which are very nice, I took a picture of my daughter in front of the tree and one of the staff members came over to ask if I would like to be in the picture with her. Everyone that I met there had a smile on their face and that is why I would likely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location.

reviews.text: I reserved my room through naming my own price on Priceline several months ago. Got the room for $80/night which I feel is a total steal given the hotel's central location to Thames Street and Broadway. Hotel Viking is a nicely appointed older boutique hotel but beware that rooms can be a bit noisy. Our room was #208 and we heard loud music coming from the lounge below us until midnight each night. I can't really complain considering the deal I scored on Priceline but if I had paid full price for the room and had to listen to the loud music below me I wouldn't have been so happy.
reviews.title: More upscale than what the Vikings had.

reviews.text: Skip the expensive parking fee the hotel charges and park your car on Kay Street directly across from the hotel for free. Also, if you don't want to pay $20 for the hotel breakfast buffet, walk 5 minutes to the Corner Cafe on Broadway. Excellent food at a fair price. Try the Vermont omelet - it was fantastic!
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Beautiful atmosphere. Well appointed room. My room was small but very cozy, maximized the use of the allotted space. Very friendly and helpful staff. Bed was very comfortable. Concierge was very accommodating.
reviews.title: Great Thanksgiving Weekend at the Viking
